For the moaners who also seem to have no fucking clue.
It is EASY to create a massive sized avi like this if you are unsure of what you are doing. This can happen with ANY software so it isn't because he used a certain program. It is all to do with one simple little IMPORTANT setting: the compression, codec selection. A lot of first timers will use some software to rip to avi and not change or set the codec up. Usually in that case, on Windows at least, you have microsoft uncompressed selected by default so you end up with the biggest avi file ever.
So the guy tried, at least give him credit for that. but honestly, to the uploader, I would have stopped this one and made a new rip, deleted this seed as so many folk are going to be waiting much much longer than they would if you even just upped the whole DVD as an image file.
Anyway, that's me done.
